questions.question: Where is the famous architectural marvel, completed in 2010, that stands as the tallest man-made structure on Earth?

answer.label: Burj Khalifa, Dubai, United Arab Emirates

questions.context: At a height of 828 meters, this skyscraper was designed by Adrian Smith and features an observation deck that offers breathtaking views of the city and Persian Gulf.

questions.question: Which UNESCO World Heritage Site in Italy is known for its well-preserved remains of a Roman city destroyed by a volcanic eruption in 79 AD?
questions.context: This site gives an extraordinary snapshot of Roman life, frozen at the moment it was buried under volcanic ash from Mount Vesuvius.

questions.question: What is the location of the large-scale architectural installation in Spain, known for its intricate mosaics and unique blends of nature and design, by architect Antoni Gaudí?
questions.context: Originally planned as a garden city, this creation by Gaudí is now a public park and a UNESCO World Heritage Site, reflecting his artistic plenitude.

questions.question: Which ancient Roman amphitheater, considered one of the greatest works of Roman engineering, can be found in the center of Rome?
questions.context: This iconic structure could hold 50,000 spectators and hosted gladiatorial contests, animal hunts, and even mock naval battles.

questions.question: Where can you find the stone-carved treasury of a city known for its archaeological significance, which served as the capital of the Nabataean Kingdom?
questions.context: Famed for its rock-cut architecture and water conduit system, this city is also known as the 'Rose City' due to the color of the stone.
